positiontitle: Cashier & Back of House Ops (Shaver, Topper, etc.)
description_sanitized:
Join Powder and be part of the launch team for our food truck/trailer at SPARK SOCIAL in Mission Bay SF! Spark Social is San Francisco's newest food truck park and we'll be joining them in mid-April 2018. As part of launch team, you'll have a variety of responsibilities (cashier, snow production, brand ambassador, etc.) as well as see first hand what it takes to launch a new location (great opportunity for those interested in hospitality or entrepreneurship). 

Characteristics we're looking for:
1. "One team, one dream" attitude -- I'll do anything to support my Powder Family.
2. "Can't stop, won't stop" work ethic -- this job isn't always glamorous but we have fun with it.
3. "Steph Curry" Composure -- sometimes operations can get chaotic and stressful. . . can you handle it?
4. Strong communication skills -- you'll need to be able to explain what Powder is all about!
5. Customer-first mentality -- we want everyone who tries Powder to have the best possible experience.
6. Restaurant or food retail experience -- while you might not be familiar with shaved snow, knowing food safety procedures and customer service is critical!

QUALIFICATIONS
High school diploma or GED diploma.
Minimum 6 months of customer service (retail, restaurant, coffee etc.)
Well groomed and dressed appropriately when working
Flexibility to work nights, weekends and holidays
Ability to lift up to 25lbs - move, bend, twist and kneel
Ability to stand for long periods of time
Must pass 10-year background check

Our food truck will be located at Spark Social SF (601 Mission Bay Boulevard North, San Francisco, CA 94158). We are currently seeking for full-time and part-time team members, who can begin training in the next couple of weeks.

Compensation - $14/hr plus tips!
compensation: $14/hr + shared tips + bi-annual performance bonus /  Negotiable based on experience level
company_description: Powder is a new SF-based frozen dessert company located on Divisadero and Haight St. We're is lifting the veil on one of Taiwan’s oldest treasures - Shaved Snow. Think ice cream meets shaved ice. It’s creamy, yet delicate and airy, like freshly fallen snow. We serve it up with a fresh and healthy California spin, using organic dairy and flavorful & locally sourced ingredients.
address: 260 Divisadero St, San Francisco, CA 94117, USA

description_sanitized:
Description

Are you looking for an exciting opportunity for your next career? Do you want exposure to quality food products, premium ingredients and household items? If so we may have the job for you.

Meraki Market is a small but very special grocery store. We are seeking highly motivated individuals to staff the floor; ring customers up, and answer any and all questions a client might have, just to mention a couple of job duties. If you are looking for a job that is interesting, educational, and most-of-all, food-centric then this is definitely the job for you!

Cashier Job Description
We are looking for an accountable cashier to process all cash transactions accurately and efficiently in accordance with established policies and procedures. The successful candidate will play a fundamental role in achieving our customer satisfaction and revenue growth objectives. Duties and responsibilities of the cashier will include but not limited to greeting customers when entering or leaving our establishment, maintaining a clean and tidy checkout area and keeping reports of cash and credit transactions.
Responsibilities:
-Handle cash transactions with customers using cash registers.
-Scan goods and collect payments.
-Issue receipts, refunds, change or tickets.
-Redeem stamps and coupons.
-Make sales referrals, cross-sell products and introduce new ones.
-Resolve customer complaints, guide them and provide relevant information.
-Greet customers when entering or leaving establishments.
-Maintain clean and tidy checkout areas.
-Keep reports of transactions.
-Bag, box or wrap packages. He/she must know how to pack items appropriately. This will help in avoiding tear of shopping bags as well as to ensure that a bag contains maximum number of items.
-Pleasantly deal with customers to ensure satisfaction.

Requirements
-Proven working experience in retail cashier or sales.
-Basic PC knowledge and familiarity with electronic equipment (e.g. cash register, scanners, money counters etc).
-Strong communication and time management skills.
-Customer satisfaction-oriented.
-Attention to detail and mathematical skills.
-Sales skills.
-High school degree.
company_description: Meraki Market is a one-of-a kind, upscale food store that will be providing the highest quality products to people with discerning palates. This San Francisco based business will specialize in offering lifestyle culinary gifts, “made today for today” sandwiches, salads and prepared meals, cooked with the utmost artistry and care.

company_description:
Established in 2010.
Twenty Five Lusk was a dream that was 14 years in the making.  Chef/Partner, Matthew Dolan and General Manager/Partner, Chad Bourdon met at the Culinary Institute of America circa 1996.  Departing in 2000 as close friends the two spent the next 10 years honing there craft at top restaurants and every year getting together regardless of where they were in the world to discuss one day opening their restaurant.  In 2007, despite NYC aspirations with investors in place, the choice was San Francisco.  Despite the horrible economic downfall of 2008 the duo stuck it out and their partners pulled through.

description_sanitized:
Bartlett Hall is in search of excellent people with a passion for great food, beverages, and hospitality. We are looking to add to talented people to our great team, to help us grow as the best gastropub in Union Square.

We are Currently Hiring for a Breakfast Server

WEEKEND/EARLY MORNING AVAILABILITY REQUIRED!

Bartlett Hall captures the essence of San Francisco in the form of food, drink and good times. Situated amid the hustle and bustle of San Francisco's Union Square, the gastropub and brewery fuses the city's historic elements with its present day lively personality--serving as an authentic reflection of San Francisco where quality, comfort and craft reign supreme. An eating and drinking establishment like no other that attracts to visitors and locals alike to enjoy house-brewed beers, barrel-aged cocktails, and uniquely crafted bites from lunch to late night. The team of seasoned Chefs have designed a seasonally-driven menu that's both approachable and forward-thinking. In the true San Francisco fashion, the beverage program runs the gamut of traditional and innovative offerings, including local craft and house-brewed beers, artisan cocktails, and California-focused wines.

Please send us a copy of your resume in the body of the email along with a brief introduction. You may also DROP OFF your resume between the hours of 11:30 am-12:30 pm and 2:30-5:00 pm; you may ask for a manager (a manager may or may not be available to meet you). 

To learn more about Bartlett Hall, visit us on the web at www.bartletthallsf.com

Bartlett Hall is located at 242 O'Farrell Street (cross Cyril Magnin). We are open 7 days a week, 11:30am to 1:30 am.

description_sanitized:
The Cavalier is looking for a Full Time Manager to join our team in bringing award winning hospitality to our clientele.  We are looking for an energetic, hospitality minded individual who is interested in growing with a growing company.
About Us:
The Cavalier is located blocks from Union Square in San Francisco's SOMA District, in the Viceroy operated Hotel Zetta.  It joins its sister restaurants with both a three star rating from The San Francisco Chronicle, and a listing on the Chronicle's "Top 100 Bay Area Restaurants" for 2014. The Cavalier and Park Tavern were both named James Beard Semi-Finalists for "Best New Restaurant in America" in 2014 and 2012 respectively.

Big Night Group is a hospitality management firm founded by restaurateurs Anna Weinberg and James Nicholas, which comprise a thriving collection of award-winning restaurants and culinary talent.  Along with chef partner Jennifer Puccio, Big Night owns and operates successful San Francisco restaurants Marlowe, Park Tavern, The Cavalier, Leo’s Oyster Bar and most recently, Petit Marlowe.   James Beard award winning pastry chef Emily Luchetti has joined Big Night to lead dessert programs at its portfolio of restaurants.

We are looking for an experienced service manager to join our restaurant team and help us grow. This position will report to the General Manager and will be responsible for ensuring the delivery of consistent, customer focused service while exhibiting a passion for food and wine. The ideal candidate should excel in a high volume, fast paced environment, focusing on training staff and team motivation.

Responsibilities:
• Overseeing the restaurant and front of house service team with strong attention to detail
• Upholding standards of service and ensuring guest satisfaction during all service shifts
• Open and close the restaurant; must be available on weekends and holidays
• Train staff on proper steps of service and guest standards
• Complete additional tasks as assigned by the General Manager in a timely fashion and with attention to detail

Qualifications:
Minimum 2 years fine dining restaurant experience with strong service skills required 
2 years experience in restaurant management preferred
Knowledgeable of food, wine and spirits
Knowledgeable of OpenTable and POS systems
Adobe Illustrator and InDesign experience a plus
Stable job history 

There is great growth potential with this position as the company is in the process of expansion. Compensation and benefits packages are competitive and is commensurate with experience.
company_description: Big Night Restaurant Group is a hospitality management firm founded by restauranteurs Anna Weinberg and James Nicholas, which comprises a thriving collection of award-winning restaurants and culinary talent. Along with chef partner Jennifer Puccio, Big Night owns and operates successful San Francisco restaurants Marlowe, Park Tavern, The Cavalier and Leo's Oyster Bar. In September 2014, renowned pastry chef Emily Luchetti joined Big Night to lead dessert programs at its portfolio of restaurants. All four restaurants have earned three stars from the San Francisco Chronicle and have received numerous accolades including being listed in the Chronicle’s lauded “Top 100 Bay Area Restaurants”. Park Tavern and The Cavalier were James Beard Award semifinalists for “Best New Restaurant” in 2012 and 2014 respectively, and Leo's Oyster Bar is a James Beard Award finalist with Ken Fulk for "Restaurant Design" in 2017.
address: 360 Jessie St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA

description_sanitized:
Jasper's Corner Tap & Kitchen team is looking for a Line Cook . Line Cooks are to ensure the quality preparation of all menu items and proper handling/storage of all food items. The preparation occurs at the direction and supervision of the Chef.

*After six months of continuous employment, receive a $300 BONUS!

This is a terrific opportunity for anyone looking to learn and grow plus join us to be a part of our 20 million dollar renovation in 2018. The current name is Serrano Hotel and we're looking forward to an exciting hotel name change after the renovation is completed.

Just steps away from Union Square, Serrano Hotel is perfectly positioned in the Theater District of San Francisco on Taylor Street. The 17-story Spanish-Moroccan style Serrano dates back from 1928 and our hotel rooms gives our guest the best vantage point to experience San Francisco! We offer 236 rooms/suites and our restaurant, Jasper’s Corner Tap and Kitchen for guests to enjoy.

Duties & Responsibilities:
  • Food preparation and presentation in one or more stations of a large commercial kitchen: pantry, saute, grill
  • Follow standardized recipes and ensure consistent preparation according to guest specifications
  • Participate in cleaning of kitchen areas and equipment
  • Assist with proper storage, preparation, cooking and presentation of all food items
  • Assist with food preparation in advance of food service hours
  • Follow all safety guidelines include safe-handling of food items, knife safety, safe usage of kitchen equipment, etc.

Qualifications:
  • Must have flexible schedule including availability on nights, weekends, and holidays
  • Punctuality and regular and reliable attendance
  • Interpersonal skills and the ability to work well with co-workers and the public
  • Must be able to verbally communicate in English
  • Must be able to read written instructions in English
  • To be able to demonstrate and execute the various cooking methods including sauteing, braising, fryer, poaching, roasting and all the other subtle variations of them
  • Previous kitchen experience is required
  • Must be able to work in a clean and organized fashion with strict adherence to all safe food handling practices
  • Must be able to work in a hot kitchen environment
  • Active Food Handler certificate is preferred

Jasper’s is the kind of place with a friendly culture and competitive benefits that will love you back. We offer great health insurance, 401k, complimentary life insurance, paid sick, paid vacation, commuter benefits, invitation to all team appreciation events, and more for eligible team members
About Jaspers
Jasper's Corner Tap & Kitchen is a San Francisco favorite casual dining restaurant. Jasper's serves innovative San Francisco cuisine & Cocktails that blend the best American, California, and World flavors into exceptional, contemporary pub experience. Serrano Hotel is just steps away from Union Square, Serrano Hotel is perfectly positioned in the Theater District of San Francisco on Taylor Street. T We offer 236 rooms/suites and our restaurant, Jasper’s Corner Tap and Kitchen for guests to enjoy. Join us to be a part of our exciting and upcoming multi-million dollar renovation planned in 2017...stay tuned for details! Jasper's Restaurant & Serrano Hotel is part of Access Hotels & Resorts where we strive in helping our team members excel in an environment that fosters creativity and determination. We are passionate about everything we do, we encourage innovation and ideas and recognize the value of balancing living, learning, and leisure.
compensation: $16/hour (PM shifts, must be available on weekends)

description_sanitized:
Jasper's Corner Tap & Kitchen team is looking for a Dishwasher/Steward. Dishwasher/Stewards assist the kitchen team in cleaning kitchen supplies and maintaining a clean work environment while property adhering to safety guidelines.

This is a terrific opportunity for anyone looking to learn and grow plus join us to be a part of our 20 million dollar renovation in 2018. The current name is Serrano Hotel and we're looking forward to an exciting hotel name change after the renovation is completed.

Just steps away from Union Square, Serrano Hotel is perfectly positioned in the Theater District of San Francisco on Taylor Street. The 17-story Spanish-Moroccan style Serrano dates back from 1928 and our hotel rooms gives our guest the best vantage point to experience San Francisco! We offer 236 rooms/suites and our restaurant, Jasper’s Corner Tap and Kitchen for guests to enjoy.

Duties & Responsibilities:

-Clean and store all dishes, flatware, glassware as well as kitchen and banquet equipment in a timely and organized way
-Properly dispose of all garbage from kitchen and restaurant areas
-Sort and dispose of all recyclable materials ensuring minimal waste
-Participate in cleaning of kitchen areas and equipment, including sweeping, mopping and scrubbing of equipment
-Follow all safety guidelines and proper use of cleaning chemicals and safely cleaning of equipment
-Maintains a clean and organized work environment at all times, following all Health Department guidelines.

Qualifications:

-Must have flexible schedule including days, nights, weekends, and holidays
-Prior cleaning experience in a commercial kitchen, preferably in a full-service boutique or --luxury resort environment
-The employee is required to stand and walk for an extended period of time. They will also frequently stoop, crouch, and kneel for duration of their shift (8hrs). The employee must also be able to lift, move, carry, push, and place objects weighing less than or equal to 50 pounds without assistance
-Must be able to multi-task and display ability to recognize that the team members' and guests' needs are always primary

Jasper’s is the kind of place with a friendly culture and competitive benefits that will love you back. We offer great health insurance, 401k, complimentary life insurance, paid sick, paid vacation, commuter benefits, invitation to all team appreciation events, and more for eligible team members

description_sanitized:
CatHead’s BBQ is a small neighborhood BBQ spot, cooking in built-in brick bbq pits. We take old family recipes, update and make them from scratch. Our staff is small, hard working and dedicated. We are looking for a hard working committed Line cook.

CatHead’s BBQ can offer the right candidate an opportunity for long-term growth and development as we expand. Our kitchen is fast paced with high volume despite a small footprint. This position is a great opportunity for someone to hone skills in a role in which organization, scheduling, & efficiency are key. The Line cook will play a huge role in the day-to-day service, prep, and catering.

Customer service is extremely important to us. Our kitchen is open and customers often interact with us.

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
·Assist in daily kitchen operations.
·Maintain cleanliness and organization of kitchen, storage, and common use areas.
·Keeping a fire during shift.
·Able to lift 50+ pounds.
·Assist in keeping quality controls, ensuring that every plate of food served up to our standards.
·Enforce proper handling and storage of all foods including, proper cooling and holding temperatures, labeling and FIFO rotation.
·Must be able to work the line as needed, independently and as back-up.


Qualifications include but are not limited to:
·Ideal candidates will have 1-2 years of line cook experience.
·Have a passion for cooking from scratch.
·Responsible and hardworking with a desire to learn.
·Great knife skills, cleanliness, organization, and attention to detail are a must!
·Responsible for setting up, organizing, cleaning & sanitizing stations and the kitchen. 
·Being a self-starter, able to work independently and as part of a team.
·Must have a great attitude, be a team player, and have the ability to communicate with coworkers & customers
·Must be ServSafe Certified


CatHead’s BBQ offers:
·Paid vacation
·Health benefits
·Very competitive wages with a tip pool.
·Opportunity to grow and learn all aspects in a small business ran by two passionate, talented hard working owners.
address: 1665 Folsom St, San Francisco, CA 94103, United States

company_description:
The Village Pub:
Veteran San Francisco restaurateurs - Tim Stannard, Mark Sullivan, and Andrew Green - set out to create a dining experience that offers guests a relaxed and inviting environment to enjoy innovative fare prepared with the finest ingredients available. In addition to being recognized both locally and nationally for its award-winning cuisine, The Village Pub has also received consistent praise for its unparalleled wine and spirits program.

Pizza Antica:
Pizza Antica's journey began over 10 years ago with the opening of the first location in Santana Row. Our goal was to evoke the feeling of eating in a classic Roman pizzeria, while cooking with pristine local ingredients from small family farmers. We have since opened additional restaurants in Mill Valley, Lafayette, and Danville.

Spruce:
Chef Mark Sullivan’s California-inspired cuisine showcases the freshest and finest ingredients available. About 80 percent of the restaurant’s produce comes from SMIP Ranch, a private five-acre farm located in the hills above Woodside that grows vegetables, herbs, and other specialty crops exclusively for Bacchus Management Group’s family of restaurants.

description_sanitized:
We are looking for a sous chef to help provide strategic direction and execution to our menu & private events programs. 

In assistance to the Executive chef, the Sous Chef is responsible for all food production, including restaurant, banquet functions and other outlets. This sous chef will help develop menus, food purchase specifications, and recipes. They will supervise staff, develop and monitor food & labor budgets, while maintaining the highest professional food quality and sanitation standards. This manager must maintain operations and drive results through people development and menu execution. They must help hire, train & develop employees, and be a creative team player. 

Fifth Arrow is looking for a talented individual with a proven track record in team leadership, specifically in a fast-paced kitchen, who will execute with the same high standards found in fine dining restaurants. We want someone with experience in managing & executing large private events with precision and timing. To be successful in this role, they will also share our enthusiasm for fostering growth in our team. 
 
POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE: 
  • Preparation of daily menus. Execution of recipes, service, and private events. 
  • Executing standard recipes & techniques for food preparation & presentation, helping to assure consistent high quality, and minimize food costs. Exercise portion control for all items served and assists in establishing menu-selling prices. 
  • Estimate food requirements and food/labor costs. 
  • Interview and make recommendations of candidates for new hire. 
  • Train, develop, and evaluate personnel on proper use of kitchen equipment & tools, techniques, and skills. 
  • Ability to relieve, assist, or fill in for any kitchen position as needed. 
  • Have a genuine desire to lead the team in producing high quality products. 
  • Observe workers to ensure that methods of cooking, garnishes, and portion sizes are as prescribed. 
  • Cook or directly supervise the cooking of items that require skillful preparation and execution. 
  • Ensure that high standards of sanitation, cleanliness, and safety are maintained throughout all kitchen areas at all times.  
  • Establish controls to minimize food & supply waste and theft. 
  • Determine if and/or when policy or procedural infractions by employees occur and issue the appropriate level of progressive discipline. 
  • Responsible for the timely evaluation of all direct reports and, with the Executive Chef, conducting introductory period and annual performance reviews. 
  • Maintain an open door policy and addresses all team member issues and/or concerns in a timely manner. 
  • Rectify arising problems or complaints. 
  • Conduct meetings with departmental management and line level staff. 
  • Create a work environment that promotes teamwork, performance feedback, recognition, mutual respect and employee satisfaction; quality hiring, training and succession planning processes. 
  • Maintain a professional, neat, and well-groomed appearance, adhering to appearance standards. 
  • Establish and maintain regular cleaning & maintenance schedule for all kitchen areas and equipment. 
  • Arrange for equipment maintenance and repairs. 
  • Consult with Executive Chef on food production aspects of special events. 
  • Help organize and attend food & beverage staff & management meetings. 
  • Ability to work varied shifts, including weekends and holidays. 
  • Lead by example. 
 
SPECIFIC POSITION REQUIREMENTS: 
  • Minimum of 2 years managerial experience in a culinary position in an upscale and/or high volume foodservice establishment. 
  • Must hold a current ServSafe certificate. 
  • Must possess knowledge of all aspects of running a kitchen, including food costing, budgeting, taking inventory, forecasting, proper ordering & receiving, staff management, etc. 
  • Must have full working knowledge of POS system. 
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, busy, and somewhat stressful environment and maintain physical stamina, proper mental attitude while dealing effectively with guests, management, team members, and outside contacts while working under pressure and meeting deadlines. 
  • Ability to work with others, communicate well, receive direction; review your own work. 
 
This is an opportunity to make a distinctive mark on the food & entertainment industry, by providing creative style, quality, and execution to an outstanding culinary experience, worthy of the City of San Francisco. If you feel you embody that passion and a desire for excellence, please send a cover letter and resume for review.
company_description: August Hall // Fifth Arrow is a new music venue, event space & restaurant gaming parlor near Union Square, in downtown San Francisco. As a music venue, August Hall will raise the bar of modern entertainment establishments. As a restaurant, Fifth Arrow will elevate the culinary experience while playing host to a sophisticated bar and parlor atmosphere. As an event space, August Hall // Fifth Arrow can accommodate everything from large corporate events to intimate birthday celebrations. Our goal to contribute an exceptionally high standard to the Food & Entertainment industry.

company_description: Project Juice is a leading cold-pressed juice and clean foods company founded in San Francisco with operations in both Northern and Southern California. The Company was founded based on personal necessity, through our own struggles with food allergies and sensitivities. Our passion came about after experiencing the undeniable benefits of consuming a mostly plant based diet and incorporating nutrient rich cold pressed juices into our lives. The Project was born out of our desire to share these benefits with you.
address: 364 Hayes St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA
businessname: Project Juice Hayes Valley AND Market

description_sanitized:
Bartender- Hayes Street Grill

 

The Hayes Street Grill is an old-school seafood restaurant that's been at the forefront of the local, sustainable, organic food movement since 1979. We provide high-level service to the Opera, Ballet, Symphony, SF Jazz, and City Arts pre-performance crowds. We’re proud to be family owned and still maintain much of the original staff.

 

We’re looking for a bartender that has experience with cocktails, wine, and food service. Picking up waiting shifts is also a possibility. This is a fast-paced environment and attention to detail is always a must.

 

Minimum two years experience preferred. Classic cocktail, espresso, and inventory control experience is a plus.
company_description:
Hayes Street Grill is a fish restaurant in San Francisco’s Performing Arts district.  The restaurant is across the street from Davies Symphony Hall and Nourse Auditorium, one block from the Opera House and SFJazz,  and two blocks from City Hall.

We opened the grill in 1979 to serve dinner before the opera, ballet and symphony, drawing inspiration from old San Francisco grills like Tadich and Sam’s.  But we took the grill concept a step farther by committing to using only fresh, not frozen fish,  and as many local ingredients as we could find. To that end, our menu changes daily.

Hayes Street Grill is certified by the Monterey Bay Aquarium Seafood Watch.  Our produce comes directly from local farms: Mariquita, WHOA Farm, Everything Under the Sun, Brokaw, Hamada, Yerena, Chue’s, McGinnis, Alfieri, Bella Viva, Heirloom Organics, Martin Bournhonesque and many others at the Ferry Plaza Farmers Market.  Co-owner Patricia Unterman is a founder of that market.  Most of our meats, poultry and dairy come from small producers who we know.

Many of our cooks, dining room staff  and maitre d’s have worked at the restaurant for twenty-five or more years. Performing artists and artistic directors consider the restaurant their club.  Their autographed photos line the walls.
address: 320 Hayes Street, San Francisco, CA, United States

description_sanitized:
Goat Hill is looking for enthusiastic, outgoing pizza loving people to join our team. Duties include (but are not limited to) assisting customers in-person, online and over the phone with pick up and deliveries, assembling individual orders, stocking supplies and working directly with the kitchen to execute orders.

If you enjoy working in a fast paced environment, are reliable and have a willingness to learn, this is the job for you! Some restaurant experience is helpful. Positions available at all three locations.
company_description:
Fall, 1975  -- At the time there were few places to eat in the neighborhood. Five Potrero Hill residents decided to do something about this.  Phil DeAndrade, Karen (Clark) Monley,  Ruthann Dickinson and  Joel and Loris Lipski each kicked in some borrowed money and took over the Hollander, a burnt-out ribs and hamburger joint at the  corner of 18th and  Connecticut.
Goat Hill was a shoestrings operation. Phil was the only restaurateur;  Joel, learning on the job, built the original counters and walk-in refrigerator and, with help from contractor neighbors John Goulet and Bill Stokes, did all the wiring and plumbing.  Everyone took turns cooking pizza, waiting on tables, washing dishes, mopping up at night.  Ruthann was the first table attendant. Loris was in charge of the homemade soups, sauces and dressings – all the while taking care of new daughter Jennifer – three months older than the restaurant. Karen came home from her job in the financial district to help out; her daughter Beth became the first dishwasher; Patti Horan was the first employee. Other family members and Potrero Hill friends made Goat Hill a neighborhood project.
We chose the name Goat Hill after seeing old photographs of goats roaming the rocky outcroppings on Potrero Hill among the tents and temporary housing that were the post-earthquake homes of Irish and eastern European settlers.
The original décor was in the style of the times: uncomfortable wooden benches in dark booths decorated with macramé cobwebs. Bill Stokes donated the piano that is still in use; and soon Harold Bradford was entertaining at the keyboard a couple of times a week. 
The building was half the size it is now.  The back dining room was a vacant lot – a perfect rocky pasture for the restaurant’s pet and mascot…. Goat Hilda. Hilda had two kids, Loretta and Bucky; and the three of them remained neighborhood pets until the 1985 expansion when they found a new home at the Sonoma State Hospital in Glen Ellen. 
For thirty-eight years, there have been many new faces and new menu items, but we trust that Goat Hill Pizza is still the same welcoming neighborhood place, serving the great food and friendliness that we had in mind back in 1975.
address: 171 Stillman St, San Francisco, CA 94107, USA

description_sanitized:
As a Barback, you must be efficient without looking rushed, neat without looking frazzled, and aware of the restaurants present and future needs.

You are responsible for setting up and breaking down the bar, clearing and setting as guests leave or arrive,  and assisting with service during the course of the meal by providing water service, helping clear empty plates and glasses, keeping water, coffee and tea refilled, etc. Always be welcoming, friendly and accommodating.

You must be able to offer help with any general restaurant questions as well as any menu food and beverage questions. It is also your responsibility to perform all barback side works and keep all service areas clean, stocked and organized. 
Click here to Apply! 

If you possess a positive attitude and strong work ethic, but do not have much experience, we are willing to train. 
Click here to Apply! 
The Saratoga is part of Bacchus Management Group, a boutique San Francisco-based hospitality and lifestyle business that owns and oversees two Michelin-starred restaurants, Spruce in San Francisco, and The Village Pub in Woodside; also The Village Bakery in Woodside; Mayfield Bakery & Cafe in Palo Alto; and Pizza Antica (Lafayette, Mill Valley, Santana Row, Danville). In addition to their restaurants, they have a coffee roasting company, RoastCo; a private farm, SMIP Ranch; and proprietary self-titled magazine, Bacchus.
company_description:
The Village Pub:
Veteran San Francisco restaurateurs - Tim Stannard, Mark Sullivan, and Andrew Green - set out to create a dining experience that offers guests a relaxed and inviting environment to enjoy innovative fare prepared with the finest ingredients available. In addition to being recognized both locally and nationally for its award-winning cuisine, The Village Pub has also received consistent praise for its unparalleled wine and spirits program.

Pizza Antica:
Pizza Antica's journey began over 10 years ago with the opening of the first location in Santana Row. Our goal was to evoke the feeling of eating in a classic Roman pizzeria, while cooking with pristine local ingredients from small family farmers. We have since opened additional restaurants in Mill Valley, Lafayette, and Danville.

Spruce:
Chef Mark Sullivan’s California-inspired cuisine showcases the freshest and finest ingredients available. About 80 percent of the restaurant’s produce comes from SMIP Ranch, a private five-acre farm located in the hills above Woodside that grows vegetables, herbs, and other specialty crops exclusively for Bacchus Management Group’s family of restaurants.
address: 1000 Larkin St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

positiontitle: Highly Anticipated Che Fico Looking For Hosts
description_sanitized:
Che Fico, a new California Italian restaurant, is looking for talented hosts. Chefs David Nayfeld (Eleven Madison Park) and James Beard Award winner Angela Pinkerton (Eleven Madison Park, Craftsman & Wolves) have partnered with operator Matt Brewer (Hogsalt Hospitality) to bring Che Fico to San Francisco’s Nopa neighborhood in early 2018. Che Fico will feature handmade pasta, pizza, charcuterie, wood fired meats and other dishes utilizing local California ingredients as if the Bay Area was a region in Italy. Che Fico will have a robust craft cocktail program as well as a very developed wine and beverage program featuring local California and Italian wines and beverages. Che Fico is first and foremost a San Francisco restaurant and it will establish itself as a member of the community through warm hospitality and a generous spirit.
If you are outgoing, friendly and have a super positive attitude we want you to join our team of service industry professionals. Experience managing wait lists, using Open Table and high volume / fine dining restaurant experience is a plus. However we are willing to train the right individuals and are looking for people who are interested in pursuing careers in the hospitality industry. Che Fico will be a very rewarding place to work with lots of room to advance and potential to learn and grow. A great attitude and willingness to learn are the most important traits we are looking for.
Education will play one of the most important roles in the restaurant and staff will be accountable for learning all about Italian food and wine, our food and beverages and potential allergens. We will have in-depth line ups, seminars and training on an ongoing basis to set us up for success in these areas.
We will provide competitive wages and tips, and healthcare to all employees who qualify, there will also be many opportunities for advancement for motivated individuals. We will host staff events, field trips and seminars to build restaurant culture and further our development as a team. We want this to be the most fun and rewarding job you have ever had in the service industry and we are seeking talented professionals.
The staff culture at Che Fico will be fun, educational and passionate about our work. We are seeking individuals that want to share in our common goals and have a strong desire for growth and success.
Please send us your resume and a brief note about you and why you want to work at Che Fico. We look forward to meeting you!
Matt, David, Angela
address: 838 Divisadero St, San Francisco, CA 94117, USA

positiontitle: Umami Burger Soma is Hiring Servers!
description_sanitized:
JOIN THE MOVEMENT IN THE SOMA DISTRICT.......
Umami Burger is a growing phenomenon opening multiple new locations throughout the United States. If you are looking to thrive in a fast-paced environment, if you love to savor life, if you are fun and outgoing and want exciting career opportunity and to be a part of something great, not just a restaurant....you are about to be UMAMIFIED and we WANT you!

Hiring SERVERS from now until the end of time...well, sort of. A GREAT job + A FUN working environment = Best. Job. EVER!! We can't wait to "meat" you!!!!

Job Description: 
- A Team Member with extensive Serving Experience; doesn't necessarily need to have held this position previously but preferred. 

Specifically: Umami Burger Soma District


LET'S DO THIS!!!!

- Must be a true believer in the Company and its product, and share your passion with the guests in a fun and playful way.
- Must be a genuine and honest human being.
- Must have an ownership-driven mentality with hands on attitude.
- Projects and assignments are completed thoroughly, professionally and with care in a timely manner.
- Adjusts to high pressure situations and is open to change.
- Assumes responsibility for personal growth and development.
- Conducts themselves (acts and dresses) professionally at all times while setting the standard for all team members.
- Expresses ideas and conveys information clearly, effectively and professionally.
- Works to resolve disagreements; is respectful of peers and co-workers.

PM Line Cook Full Time

description_sanitized:
Server
Farallon Restaurant is one of San Francisco's most engaging, professional, and positive work environments. We are seeking a professional candidate who has a minimum three years of major market, top tier restaurant experience as a server.

Incredible charisma, exceptional hospitality judgment, and a positive attitude are requirements for this position!
Qualified candidates are expected to be competent in the following:

The types of wines (grape varietal/blends) and varietal/blend style that are being produced in the major wine growing regions of:
France, Italy, Spain, Germany, North and South America, Australia, New Zealand.


A menu that changes daily and the ability to relay all food and wine products to our guests in a personable, professional, well spoken and grammatically sound manner.


The ability to compare and contrast styles, textures, and flavors of food and wine to guests with confidence.


An understanding of service expectations and operational principles of a fine dining restaurant operation, specifically in regards to standards of service, verbiage, grooming, organization and cleanliness.


Please understand that candidates without these as minimum qualifications will not be considered.

Full time positions only.
Please include your Resume/CV in your response - attachments will not be opened.

Kind Regards,

The Farallon Team
company_description:

 We offer a limited amount of culinary internship and externship opportunities on an ongoing basis to extraordinary students.
To inquire about employment or internship opportunities, please apply below!

description_sanitized:
Come be apart of the opening kitchen team at Che Fico!!

- We are looking for cooks interested in learning about handmade and extruded pasta, house-made salumi production, pizza technique, bread and dough making, wood fire cooking (oven and grill), and many other techniques in a high volume setting from Chef's with experience at the best restaurants in the world.
- We will source proteins, produce, and dry goods from many local producers and will work to expand your product knowledge base.  We will have access to a garden in Sonoma County where we will grow select produce for the restaurant and will work to have interested parties participate in cultivation and harvest.
- We offer competitive wages based on experience and two days off in a row.

Candidates must have a great attitude, a good sense of humor, drive, dedication to their craft, and a true willingness to learn.  We will provide a safe and positive working environment where you can grow as a cook and a person.  
 WE HIGHLY ENCOURAGE PEOPLE OF ALL BACKGROUNDS TO APPLY. WE SEEK DIVERSITY AMONGST OUR TEAM.

description_sanitized:
Proper Hospitality's flagship hotel opened this August in San Francisco's Mid-Market neighborhood, marking the first luxury lifestyle hotel to open in the city in over a decade. Located in a historic flatiron building on the corner of 7th and Market - where a variety of distinct neighborhoods converge - the Kelly Wearstler-designed property is leading the charge behind SF's long-awaited hospitality boom. The property features 131 guestrooms and suites in their various original configurations, and will bring much needed social spaces for guests and locals alike, including 3 ground-floor F&B venues with indoor/outdoor dining, and a long-awaited rooftop bar and lounge, Charmaine's.

San Francisco Proper is looking for Line Cooks candidates to join our Food and Beverage Team (Villon restaurant, Charmaine's Rooftop & Bar, La Bande)!

Candidates for positions should possess the following qualities: 
- Hospitality driven
- Service oriented 
- Works well others
- Eye for detail
- Sense of urgency
- Ability to multi-task 
- Calm under pressure

Must have required certification such as California Food Handlers/TIPS/ServSafe.

E-mail inquires should include:
- Copy of resume as an attachment
- Schedule of availability 


About Executive Chef Jason Franey

Jason Franey, Executive Chef at San Francisco Proper, has built his impressive career by making his mark on storied restaurants around the country, including San Francisco's Campton Place and New York City's Eleven Madison Park, where he spent six years working as Executive Sous Chef under acclaimed chef Daniel Humm and ushering in a new era of fine dining within Danny Meyer’s hospitality empire. Franey then served as Executive Chef of Seattle’s landmark Canlis Restaurant, helping shape the 60 year-old Canlis into the city’s preeminent food destination. Prior to joining San Francisco Proper, Franey held the post of Executive Chef at Monterey, California’s Restaurant 1833, honored as "Best Restaurant in Monterey" and three and a half stars by revered San Francisco Chronicle restaurant critic Michael Bauer. Franey was named a Food & Wine Best New Chef, as well as the publication’s People’s Best New Chef Northwest. In 2012, 2013 and 2014, he was a finalist for the James Beard Foundation Award for Best Chef: Northwest and in 2013, was named one of 161 Relais and Châteaux Grands Chefs in the world.
Competitive wages and benefits.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
Proper Hospitality provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics, or any other federal/state protected category

Each Proper Hotel will be a unique reflection of the vibrant community around it, but will share the same excellence in service, convenience of location, and world-class amenities provided by its local networks of co-conspirators – innovators in food, beverage, technology, art, music, fashion and wellness. 

Proper Hospitality is made up of a diverse group of passionate individuals who share a common
love for hotels and the art of hospitality. Our philosophy is simple: There is a right way to do
things and anything less just isn’t proper. We are seeking out the “best of the best” from inside
and outside of the industry to work alongside us as we grow a new kind of lifestyle Hospitality
Company inspired by a centuries-old tradition. The work is challenging and fast-paced, but
rewarding above all.

Proper Hospitality provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics, or any other federal/state protected category.
